column4: My lan is working, yet I don't have access to the internet from Ubuntu.
Did I just got ignored?
Q: My lan is working, yet I don't have access to the internet from Ubuntu.
check your DNS ? /etc/resolve.conf
It doesn't have the 'e' in the name and has my router listed.
try adding a real DNS server, in case your router is not supplying DNS.  eg. 4.2.2.2 should work as a DNS server
Same problem.
but you can ping your router?
Ok, I can ping ip's so it must be the dns.
exactly.
should I rename the file to resolve.conf from resolv.conf?
no, that was my mistake. it doesn't have an e
remove your router from it and put nameserver 4.2.2.2 and save it.
Sec.
Workies, thanks. Got any others to add to the list?
I'd check with your ISP and add theirs, though 4.2.2.2 is nice, it routes to your local area no matter where you are
How do I check via my win
windows?
ya.
start > run > cmd > ipconfig /all
Thanks a lot1
np
